document.docAuthor: Chen, Huayan, Talamas, Elijah J & Pang, Hong
document.masterDocTitle: Notes on the hosts of Trissolcus Ashmead (Hymenoptera: Scelionidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host associations. This species was reared from the eggs of
Poecilocoris latus
Dallas ( Scutelleridae ) in China.

Gan 1982 reported an unidentified species of Scelionidae attacking the eggs of
P. latus
feeding on
Camellia
trees from Yunnan Province. We examined the specimens that formed the basis of his report and we now know the species is
T. latisulcus.
According to
Gan 1982
,
T. latisulcus
could lay up to 700 eggs under laboratory conditions. There are 6-7 generations of
T. latisulcus
per year in Guangnan County of Yunnan, with a generation time of 20-30 days and they overwinter as adults.
